results.adx_keywords: Euthanasia and Assisted Suicide;Law and Legislation;Politics and Government;Legislatures and Parliaments;Paralysis;Francis;Roman Catholic Church;Italy
results.title: Man Paralyzed 12 Years Ago Becomes Italy’s First Assisted Suicide
results.abstract: The man, Federico Carboni, overcame a series of legal and bureaucratic challenges before ending his life.

media.caption: On Thursday, Federico Carboni ended his life, becoming Italy’s first legal assisted suicide. Left, Marco Cappato, treasurer of the Luca Coscioni Association, a right-to-die advocacy group, spoke at a rally

results.adx_keywords: Appointments and Executive Changes;Wrestling;Ethics and Official Misconduct;McMahon, Vince;McMahon, Stephanie (1976- );World Wrestling Entertainment Inc
results.title: Vince McMahon Steps Down as Head of W.W.E. During Misconduct Investigation
results.abstract: Mr. McMahon, the pro wrestling company’s chairman and chief executive, agreed to pay a secret settlement to an employee with whom he was said to have had an affair, The Wall Street Journal reported this week.

media.caption: Vince McMahon in 2018. He will remain involved in W.W.E.’s creative content, the company said.
media.copyright: Jesse Dittmar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Jews and Judaism;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Florida
results.title: Synagogue Sues Florida, Saying Abortion Restrictions Violate Religious Freedoms
results.abstract: A South Florida congregation said that under Jewish law, abortion “is required if necessary to protect the health, mental or physical well-being” of a pregnant woman.

media.caption: Rabbi Barry Silver of Congregation L’Dor Va-Dor said it is a violation of Jewish law to forbid a woman from having an abortion if she deems it esssential for her physical or mental health.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Rumors and Misinformation;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Ethics and Official Misconduct;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack;Republican Party
results.title: A Day After a Portrait of Pence in Danger, Trump Attacks Him Again
results.abstract: In a speech, Donald J. Trump was undeterred by the Jan. 6 House committee’s account of how his rioting supporters menaced the vice president, and the panel’s dismantling of many of his election lies.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: In a speech on Friday in Nashville, former President Donald J. Trump continued to attack his former vice president for not blocking the certification of his 2020 defeat, even though doing so would have been illegal.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Rap and Hip-Hop;Content Type: Personal Profile;Documentary Films and Programs;Theroux, Louis (1970- )
results.title: How Louis Theroux Became a ‘Jiggle Jiggle’ Sensation at Age 52
results.abstract: Decades into his career, the British American journalist has an unlikely TikTok hit that could be the song of the summer. “I am not trying to make it as a rapper,” he says.

media.caption: His money doesn’t jiggle jiggle. It folds. The documentary filmmaker (and rapper?) Louis Theroux at his home in London.
media.copyright: Alexander Coggin for The New York Times

results.title: The Future Isn’t Female Anymore
results.abstract: Where is the women’s movement when we need it most?

results.adx_keywords: Movies;Women and Girls;Sex;Content Type: Personal Profile;Nudism and Nudity;Actors and Actresses;Hyde, Sophie;Thompson, Emma
results.title: Emma Thompson and the Challenge of Baring All Onscreen at 63
results.abstract: The actress made the choice to disrobe. Still, she says, it was the most difficult thing she’s ever done in her four-decade career.

media.caption: If “you want the iconography of the female body to change,” Emma Thompson said, “then you better be part of the change.”
media.copyright: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Private Spaceflight;Labor and Jobs;Musk, Elon;Shotwell, Gwynne;Space Exploration Technologies Corp
results.title: SpaceX Said to Fire Employees Involved in Letter Rebuking Elon Musk
results.abstract: In an email, Gwynne Shotwell, SpaceX’s president, said the letter had made other employees “feel uncomfortable, intimidated and bullied.”

media.caption: A letter sent by some SpaceX employees said the public behavior and tweeting of Elon Musk, above, was “a frequent source of distraction and embarrassment.”

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Men and Boys;Child Custody and Support;Parenting;United States Politics and Government;Walker, Herschel;Warnock, Raphael G;Republican Party;Georgia
results.title: Herschel Walker Acknowledges Two More Children He Hadn’t Mentioned
results.abstract: Mr. Walker, the Republican nominee for Senate in Georgia, has often criticized absentee fathers. But this week it has emerged that in addition to a son he often talks about, he has three other children.

media.caption: Herschel Walker is running against Senator Raphael Warnock, a Democrat, in one of this year’s most pivotal Senate races.

results.adx_keywords: Quarantine (Life and Culture);Sleep;Content Type: Service;Melatonin (Hormone);Dreams;Insomnia;Psychology and Psychologists;Anxiety and Stress;Sedatives;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Jet Lag
results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Vaccination and Immunization;Children and Childhood;Food and Drug Administration;Pfizer Inc;BioNTech SE;Moderna Inc;United States
results.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Noah Weiland and Apoorva Mandavilli
results.title: F.D.A. Authorizes Moderna and Pfizer Covid Vaccines for Youngest Children
results.abstract: A recommendation from the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention would be the final step before doses are rolled out for the roughly 20 million children younger than 5.

results.adx_keywords: Shopping and Retail;Labor and Jobs;Social Media;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Content Type: Personal Profile;audio-neutral-immersive;Dollar General Corp;TikTok (ByteDance)
results.title: How a Dollar General Employee Went Viral on TikTok
results.abstract: Mary Gundel loved managing a store in Tampa, Fla. But when she detailed its challenges on social media, the company — and fellow employees — took notice.

media.caption: Mary Gundel, who managed a Dollar General in Tampa, Fla., created the hashtag #PutInATicket because, she said, that was the company’s response to serious store issues.
media.copyright: Todd Anderson for The New York Times

results.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Ben Casselman
results.title: This Is Going to Hurt
results.abstract: Inflation is expected to remain high later this year even as the economy slows and layoffs rise. Already, signs of financial stress are surfacing.

results.title: Walking on Hot Coals: A Company Event Goes Wrong
results.abstract: More than two dozen employees of a Swiss company were injured while walking in bare feet over hot coals, an ancient religious tradition that has become popular on corporate retreats.

media.caption: People walking on burning coals as they take part in the ancient tradition of Anastenaria, a fire-walking ritual, in the northern Greek village of Mavrolefke, in 2019.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Fatalities);Automobile Racing;Bowyer, Clint;Fox Sports;National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing;Missouri;Ozark (Mo)
results.title: Clint Bowyer, Former NASCAR Driver, Involved in Fatal Car Accident
results.abstract: Mr. Bowyer, now a Fox Sports analyst, called 911 and showed no sign of impairment after striking a woman with his car on a Missouri highway on June 5, the authorities said.
org_facet: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing

media.caption: Clint Bowyer in 2019. The authorities in Lake Ozark, Mo., said he showed no sign of impairment after he had struck and killed a woman who was walking on a divided highway on June 5.

results.title: As Monkeypox Spreads, a Campaign to Warn the Public Gains Urgency
results.abstract: Be aware but don’t panic, say health officials and advocates as cases of the disease tick upward in New York and around the country.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.title: J. Michael Luttig, a conservative judge, tweeted his analysis that a vice president had no power to alter the election results.
results.abstract: “The only responsibility and power of the Vice President under the Constitution is to faithfully count the electoral college votes as they have been cast,” Judge Luttig wrote.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: J. Michael Luttig, a former federal appeals court judge, said the former vice president could not decide to invalidate election results.
media.copyright: Joe Perry/The Morning News, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Police Department (Uvalde, Tex);Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: Uvalde Officer Passed Up Shot at Gunman for Fear of Hitting Children
results.abstract: A police officer had a chance to shoot the gunman before he entered a school, according to a chief deputy sheriff. The officer declined to take the shot, fearing injuries to others.

media.caption: A makeshift memorial after a shooting at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, that left 19 children and two adults dead.
media.copyright: Callaghan O'Hare for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Animal Behavior;Dogs;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Renter's Insurance;Homeowners Insurance;Law and Legislation;Pets;American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals;Insurance Information Institute;United States;Albany (NY)
results.title: Love Your Dog, but Beware of Your Homeowners’ Insurance
results.abstract: Many firms have long refused coverage or charge more for pit bulls and other dogs considered more dangerous, but New York and other states say policies shouldn’t be breed specific.
org_facet: American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals

media.caption: Felicia and Brian English walk their pit bulls near their apartment in Albany. “When I get an opportunity to adopt one, I jump at the chance. They get a bad rap,” Mr. English said.

results.adx_keywords: Dress Codes;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Civil Rights and Liberties;Discrimination;Charter Schools;Constitution (US);Women and Girls;Burks, Keely;American Civil Liberties Union;Charter Day School (Leland, NC);North Carolina
results.title: Court Sides With Girls Who Sued Over School’s Skirt Requirement
results.abstract: A North Carolina school’s dress code perpetuated “harmful” gender stereotypes and violated the 14th Amendment’s equal protection clause, a U.S. appeals court found.

media.caption: A federal appeals court ruled Tuesday that the Charter Day School in Leland, N.C., was perpetuating gender stereotypes in enforcing a dress code that required girls wear skirts.
